item.title: 法官裁定苹果未开放应用商店供竞争
item.description: 联邦法官裁定，苹果公司违反了要求其向外部支付选项开放其应用程序商店的法院命令，必须做出改变以更好地促进竞争。【原文：Apple Inc. violated a court order requiring it to open up its App Store to outside payment options and must make changes to better promote competition, a federal judge ruled.】

item.title: 美国股市反弹，全球股市创四周新高：市场综述
item.description: 随着华尔街延续反弹势头，全球股市指数攀升至四周高点，尽管市场对美国经济将在唐纳德-特朗普的贸易战重压下倒退的担忧挥之不去。【原文：A gauge of global stocks climbed to a four-week high as Wall Street extended a rebound, even as concerns linger that the US economy will buckle under the weight of Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 贸易战导致加拿大太平洋堪萨斯城铁路公司下调 2025 年指导目标
item.description: 由于美国政府的关税和贸易政策带来的不确定性，加拿大堪萨斯城太平洋有限公司（Canadian Pacific Kansas City Ltd.）下调了今年的财务展望。【原文：Canadian Pacific Kansas City Ltd. cut its financial outlook for this year due to the uncertainty caused by the US administration’s tariff and trade policy.】

item.title: 澳大利亚大选投资者指南
item.description: 在中美关税对峙继续震荡市场之际，澳大利亚紧张的联邦大选结果可能成为当地资产的下一个催化剂。【原文：The outcome of Australia’s tight federal election could be the next catalyst for local assets as a tariff standoff between the US and China continues to rattle markets.】

item.title: 美国与乌克兰签署关于获取自然资源的协议
item.description: 据一位熟悉该协议的人士称，美国和乌克兰周三就乌克兰自然资源的使用权达成协议，基辅此举旨在巩固唐纳德-特朗普总统在与俄罗斯停火谈判中的支持。【原文：The US and Ukraine reached a deal over access to Ukraine’s natural resources Wednesday, according to a person familiar with the accord, a move that Kyiv sought to solidify President Donald Trump’s backing in ceasefire talks with Russia.】

item.title: 亚马逊计划在美国建造数十个仓库以拓展农村市场
item.description: 亚马逊公司（Amazon.com Inc. ）计划在明年年底前建造数十个仓库，为美国的农村地区提供服务，随着该公司努力减少对其他运营商的依赖，其业务范围也在不断扩大。【原文：Amazon.com Inc. plans to build dozens of warehouses to serve rural areas in the US before the end of next year, growing its footprint as the company works to rely less on other carriers.】

item.title: EBay 预计销售额稳健，在关税影响下显示出韧性
item.description: EBay Inc. 预计本季度的销售额将超过分析师的预期，显示出在面临唐纳德-特朗普总统的贸易战时的韧性。【原文：EBay Inc. projected sales for the current quarter that exceeded analysts’ estimates, showing resilience in the face of exposure to President Donald Trump’s trade war.】

item.title: 广告业务稳定，Meta 收入超出预期
item.description: Meta Platforms 公司公布的第一季度销售额超过了华尔街的预期，这表明该公司的广告业务到目前为止正在经受住特朗普政府持续不断的贸易战的考验。【原文：Meta Platforms Inc. posted first-quarter sales that beat Wall Street estimates, a sign that the company’s advertising business is so far weathering the Trump administration’s ongoing trade war.】

item.title: 微软云计算部门扩张带来收入强劲增长
item.description: 微软公司公布的销售额和利润均好于预期，表明客户需求并未受到关税和更广泛的经济不确定性的影响。【原文：Microsoft Corp. reported better-than-expected sales and profit, suggesting customer demand hasn’t been rattled by tariffs and wider economic uncertainty.】

item.title: 激进投资者 Irenic Capital 增持软件制造商 Couchbase 股份
item.description: 据熟知内情的人士透露，Irenic Capital Management 公司已经增持了数据库软件提供商 Couchbase Inc.【原文：Irenic Capital Management has built a stake in database software provider Couchbase Inc., according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 贝莱德将区块链技术引入价值 1500 亿美元的财政基金
item.description: 贝莱德公司（BlackRock Inc. ）申请在其价值 1500 亿美元的货币市场基金中推出一种在区块链上注册的新股票类别，这表明该公司将数字技术引入主流机构金融的雄心日益壮大。【原文：BlackRock Inc. signaled its growing ambition to bring digital technology to mainstream institutional finance, filing to launch a new share class of its $150 billion money market fund that is registered on a blockchain.】

item.title: 在特朗普抨击高等教育之际，耶鲁大学考虑出售 8.5 亿美元债券
item.description: 耶鲁大学正考虑在 5 月份出售 8.5 亿美元的债券，加入其他精英院校的行列，在特朗普政府将矛头指向这些院校之际，寻求在资本市场筹集资金。【原文：Yale University is considering selling $850 million of bonds in May, joining other elite colleges that have looked to the capital markets to raise funding as the Trump administration targets the institutions.】

item.title: 特朗普称卡尼希望达成协议，卢布上涨
item.description: 美国总统唐纳德-特朗普表示，新当选的加拿大总理马克-卡尼计划在下周内访问白宫。【原文：US President Donald Trump said newly elected Canadian Prime Minister Mark Carney plans to visit the White House within the next week.】

item.title: 华盛顿特区的数字政府债务问题导致 15 亿美元债务的借贷成本增加
item.description: 市政债券市场已开始对华盛顿特区债务的 DOGE 影响进行定价，这可能意味着美国首都出售约 15 亿美元债券的成本会更高。【原文：The municipal-bond market is starting to price in the DOGE effect on Washington, DC’s debt, and that likely means higher costs for the nation’s capital on some $1.5 billion of bonds it’s selling.】

item.title: 瑞波币提出收购稳定币竞争对手 Circle 或高达 50 亿美元
item.description: 据熟悉内情的人士透露，瑞波公司已提议以 40 亿至 50 亿美元的价格收购竞争对手稳定币提供商 Circle Internet Group Inc.【原文：Ripple has proposed a takeover of rival stablecoin provider Circle Internet Group Inc. for $4 billion to $5 billion, a bid that was rejected as too low, according to people familiar with the matter.】

item.title: 哥伦比亚在石油公司提出要求后将利率降至 9.25% ，令人震惊
item.description: 哥伦比亚中央银行出人意料地将利率下调了 25 个基点，这标志着古斯塔沃-佩特罗总统取得了胜利，他已经看淡了投资者对财政问题的担忧，并推动降低借贷成本。【原文：Colombia’s central bank unexpectedly cut its interest rates by 25 basis points, marking a victory for President Gustavo Petro who has looked past investors’ fiscal concerns and pushed for lower borrowing costs.】

item.title: Visa 与 Stripe's Bridge 合作简化稳定币卡
item.description: Visa 公司正与 Stripe 公司的 Bridge 合作推出一个平台，允许金融科技公司为客户快速启动自己的稳定币链接卡项目。【原文：Visa Inc. is partnering with Stripe Inc.’s Bridge to launch a platform allowing fintechs to quickly start their own stablecoin-linked card programs for customers.】

item.title: 魁北克财政部长称贸易争端可能导致经济衰退
item.description: 魁北克省财政部长表示，如果加拿大不能达成协议结束与美国的贸易争端，他预计加拿大第二季度经济将放缓，并在今年晚些时候出现衰退。【原文：Quebec’s minister of finance said he predicts an economic slowdown for Canada in the second quarter and recession later in the year if the country can’t come to an agreement that ends its trade dispute with the US.】

item.title: 美元失去吸引力，墨西哥比索创 2021 年以来最佳月份
item.description: 受唐纳德-特朗普总统关税计划缓和以及美元下跌的提振，墨西哥比索有望创下 2021 年以来的最大单月涨幅。【原文：The Mexican peso is poised for its biggest monthly advance since 2021, boosted by a reprieve in President Donald Trump’s tariff plan and a drop in the US dollar.】

item.title: 英伟达获得罕见卖出评级，Seaport 称人工智能已被充分定价
item.description: Nvidia 公司周三罕见地获得了卖出评级，Seaport Global Securities 公司警告称，人工智能的好处 "目前已被定价"。【原文：Nvidia Corp. received a rare sell rating on Wednesday, with Seaport Global Securities warning that the benefit of artificial intelligence has been “priced in for now.”】

item.title: 特朗普 "反复无常 "的关税政策引发加拿大央行停摆
item.description: 加拿大央行官员曾考虑在 4 月份的会议上降息，但在权衡美国总统唐纳德-特朗普贸易政策的动荡变化后，他们选择等待更多信息。【原文：Bank of Canada officials considered cutting interest rates at their April meeting before opting to wait for more information as they weighed the volatile changes in US President Donald Trump’s trade policy.】

item.title: 嘉吉公司与麦当劳就反垄断索赔达成协议
item.description: 嘉吉公司与麦当劳公司就该快餐巨头提出的反垄断索赔达成和解，麦当劳指控牛肉供应商操纵价格。【原文：Cargill Inc. reached a settlement with McDonald’s Corp. over antitrust claims by the fast-food giant, which has alleged price fixing by beef suppliers.】

item.title: 凯雷与道富考虑合作开拓零售财富市场
item.description: State State Corp. 的资产管理部门与凯雷集团（Carlyle Group Inc.【原文：State State Corp.’s asset-management arm held preliminary talks with Carlyle Group Inc. about a potential tie-up to create a product that would combine public and private markets for individual investors.】

item.title: 南卡罗来纳学院因未能筹集到 600 万美元而关闭
item.description: 位于南卡罗来纳州的林斯顿大学（Limestone University）将在本学期结束时关闭，因为该校为继续运营而筹集资金的努力没有成功。【原文：Limestone University in South Carolina will close its doors at the end of the current academic semester after efforts to raise funds to continue operations fell short.】
